conclusion: Analyze the processes in the p-V diagram to determine heat absorbed vs. released.
The cycle consists of two adiabatic and two isochoric processes.
In an adiabatic process, no heat is exchanged (Q = 0).
Heat exchange occurs only during isochoric processes.
At points \(a\) and \(c\), the volume is constant, indicating isochoric processes.
From \(a\) to \(b\), pressure increases, temperature increases, heat added (Q > 0).
From \(d\) to \(a\), pressure decreases, temperature decreases, heat released (Q < 0).
Compare areas under curves in the p-V diagram for net heat exchange.
Process \(a \to b\) is at a higher pressure compared to \(d \to a\).
Heat absorbed from \(a \to b\) is greater than heat released from \(d \to a\).
The amount of heat absorbed during the complete cycle is greater than the amount of heat released.
